alert.note: Alert for Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 3:09PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Ulster and southwestern Dutchess Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 309 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Plattekill, or near Walden, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, half inch hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Poughkeepsie, New Paltz, Wallkill, Hyde Park, Plattekill, Pleasant Valley, Wappingers Falls, Highland, Modena, Fairview, Hopewell Junction, Marlboro, Red Oaks Mill, Myers Corner, Beekman, Lloyd, Gardiner, Tuckers Corner, Salt Point and Forest Glen. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central New York.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Dutchess; Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess
